comment: For Class C IP address, how can we use class B subnet mask?
But for class C addresses how can the subnet mask be 255.255.128.0...?

Can anyone please explain why the C2 does not have network address 203.197.0.0. Because SG=64 and octet=3. So we will start change in 3rd octet according to which network address should be 203.197.0.0 and next should be 203.197.64.0 but here first subnet is 203.197.64.0. Can someone please explain?? I am really very confused. Please solve it by simple 5 step method

For c2 if you take the third octet  75-64 you get a one matching 64 meaning that the network address is 203.197.64.0,since in the third octet the subnet generator is 64 and c2s address is in the second network address range 203.197.64.0 -203.197.127.0
i think the range is between 203.197.64.0-203.197.127.255? Could you please explain this sir.
